subject: Re: [Fwd: Re: [junit] Propagating Exceptions]
msgSnippet: A further refinement public void testUnsupported() throws Exception { try { anObject.doUnsupported(); fail( Should have thrown exception ); } catch
messageBody:
A further refinement

public void testUnsupported() throws Exception {
try {
anObject.doUnsupported();
fail("Should have thrown exception");
} catch (UnsupportedException expected) {
}
}

Any other exceptions will be caught and reported by junit.

Steve

----- Original Message -----
From: "Robert Sartin" <sartin@...>
To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, June 26, 2001 10:00 PM
Subject: Re: [Fwd: Re: [junit] Propagating Exceptions]


> /*
> --- Mike Duffy <mike.duffy@...> wrote:
> > Basically, the question was, "If you create a test method that calls
> > an updatePassword method and sends in an argument
> > that should throw an IllegalArgumentException, what do you put in the
> > catch block?"
>
> Unless the result of something else further testing, I would leave the
> catch empty as suggested:
> */
>
> public void testUnsupported() {
> try {
> objectUnderTest.doUnsupported();
> fail("doUnsupported did not throw exception");
> }
> catch (UnsupportedOperationException e) {
> // Pass
> }
> catch (Exception e) {
> fail("Wrong execption thrown by doUnsupported:" + e);
> }
>
> /*
> Regards,
>
> Rob
> */
>
